To the Editor: I am in the seventh grade. Last summer, with my parents, I went in search of the Himba in northern Namibia. We met a small group of these unique people. The Himba children, much like me, want to wear baseball caps and play games. If they knew of computers and Game Boys, I am sure they would want those, too, rather than herding cattle.

The Himba, the last nomads of Africa, can hear the call of the outside world. I say this not to stop people from visiting them, but to reinforce the idea that they are a people like us and yet very different. We must respect their ways and lend a helping hand for their transition into the 21st century, which cannot be avoided.
